title: Validate against published nonlinear benchmarks
description: Add benchmark cases from literature (plastic necking, large-deformation patch tests) with acceptance tolerances and automated regression checks.

title: Build nonlinear FEM solver on Metal
description: Create a clean-slate Swift + Metal finite element solver optimized for small models with nonlinear geometry, J2/von-Mises plasticity with ductility damage, and enforced displacement boundary conditions. Include a runnable example and tests.

title: Implement stabilization options and benchmark perturbation reduction
description: Add several explicit-solver stabilization techniques, expose controls, benchmark displacement perturbation on reference cases, and summarize effectiveness in a comparative table.

title: Implement literature nonlinear topology optimization reference problems
description: Research primary-source nonlinear topology optimization benchmarks (material and geometric nonlinearity), implement reference cases in MayorFEM using patch update strategy, and add reproducibility checks against literature targets.

title: Harden gitignore for solver outputs and validate generated artifacts
description: Ensure generated output directories/files from FEM runs are ignored by git, run representative solves to produce outputs, inspect outputs for issues, and apply fixes if needed.

title: Update 2D visualization to render quads and include density in PNG
description: Current 2D VTK/PNG writer still triangulates quad elements (uses first 3 nodes) and PNGs color only by von Mises. Update cell writing/rendering for quad4 and add density visualization in PNG output.

title: Add visualization pipeline for stress/deformation/BCs
description: Export stepwise FEM results for stress and exaggerated deformation with enforced displacement overlays; include gradual load progression output.

title: Convert primary workflow to 2D elements with subdivision and expanded tests
description: Implement a 2D nonlinear FEM pipeline with linear/quadratic triangular elements, subdivision support, updated CLI/visualization outputs, and broader test coverage.
close_reason: 2D quad workflow, subdivision, expanded tests, and literature/topopt benchmark pipeline now implemented.

title: Run fine-mesh topology optimization sweeps and summarize results
description: Execute multiple optimization runs with different settings on a relatively fine quad mesh, collect objective/volume trends, and provide output artifact locations for user review.

title: Improve topopt controls/objectives and add solver consistency validation
description: Add useful production features: target volume fraction projection, early-stop criteria, objective selection in CLI, per-iteration topopt reporting/export, and CPU-vs-Metal consistency benchmark/tests for explicit 2D solver.

title: Render stepwise PNG frames for FEM visualization
description: Add built-in PNG renderer for per-step stress/deformation/enforced-displacement outputs and wire it into CLI visualization runs.

title: Recalibrate explicit subdivision-consistency benchmark for quad formulation
description: After quad-element migration, explicit benchmark 'subdivision consistency' fails old tolerance (reaction relative diff around 0.47 vs 0.25). Re-baseline benchmark setup/tolerance against quad references.

title: Offload tangent assembly to Metal
description: Current Newton loop uses CPU element linearization for local tangents. Add a Metal path for tangent/Jacobian contributions to keep full solve path GPU-accelerated on larger meshes.

title: Add explicit nonlinear 2D Metal benchmarks and patch-based topology optimization
description: Stabilize 2D nonlinear solver, add explicit nonlinear solver path for small models, add literature-style benchmark tests, and implement patch-based topology optimization with arbitrary objective callback (default compliance).

title: Add consistent tangent and sparse global solver
description: Replace finite-difference Jacobian + dense solve with a consistent material/geometric tangent and sparse solve path to improve scalability while preserving robustness for small models.
